conclusion: To determine whether the two cars will collide, we need to analyze the velocity-time graphs (v-t graphs) of the car and the truck.
The car's v-t graph (a) shows that its velocity decreases over time.
The truck's v-t graph (b) shows that its velocity also decreases over time.
The car is traveling at 30 m/s initially.
The truck is traveling at 10 m/s initially.
The car's final velocity is 10 m/s.
The truck's final velocity is 10 m/s.
Since both cars have the same final velocity, they will collide.
Yes, the two cars will collide.
